com.spotify.sdk.android.player

Class SpotifyPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spotify.jni.NativeObject
      • com.spotify.sdk.android.player.SpotifyPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Player

    public final class SpotifyPlayer
extends com.spotify.jni.NativeObject
implements Player

    Basics

    This class is responsible for playback of Spotify content. Only one instance of this class may be instantiated at any given time; having multiple instances will cause problems. This class relies on native components for doing the actual streaming and communication with Spotify's backend services. This native code is distributed in a separate shared library.

    Normally you should not need to directly instantiate this class, instead you should use Spotify.getPlayer(Config, Object, SpotifyPlayer.InitializationObserver) to obtain a refcounted instance for you.

    Custom audio handling (PCM data)

    By default player is created with the AudioController that uses AudioTrack to play music. It is possible to override this behavior by implementing a custom AudioController and passing it to SpotifyPlayer.Builder: 
    
 Config config = new Config(...);
 MyAudioController myAudioController = new MyAudioController();
 Player.Builder builder = new Player.Builder(config);
 builder.setAudioController(myAudioController);

 Spotify = new Spotify();
 spotify.getPlayer(builder, this);

    Posting callbacks on a thread that is not a main thread

    Player by default will post all callbacks it receives on the main thread (UI thread). If you want to change this behavior or you want to run Player from a different thread than UI thread, pass custom Handler to SpotifyPlayer.Builder: 
    
 // Assuming this code runs in a different thread
 Config config = new Config(...);
 Handler myHandler = new Handler();
 Player.Builder builder = new Player.Builder(config);
 builder.setCallbackHandler(myHandler);

 Spotify = new Spotify();
 spotify.getPlayer(builder, this);

      • login

        public boolean login(String oauthToken)
        Login to the player using OAuth token. This method returns the boolean that informs if performing login was possible. The login process itself is asynchronous and the result will be delivered in ConnectionStateCallback.onLoggedIn() or the ConnectionStateCallback.onLoginFailed(Error) callback.
        Specified by:
        login in interface Player
        Parameters:
        oauthToken - Token to login with.
        Returns:
        true if player was not already logged in and login could be performed. false otherwise.

      • logout

        public boolean logout()
        Logout from the player. This method returns the boolean that informs if performing logout was possible. The logout process itself is asynchronous and the result will be delivered to the ConnectionStateCallback.onLoggedOut() callback.
        Specified by:
        logout in interface Player
        Returns:
        true if player was not already logged out and logout could be performed. false otherwise.

      • playUri

        public void playUri(Player.OperationCallback callback,
                    String uri,
                    int index,
                    int positionInMs)
        Play a URI with the player. If the player is not yet fully initialized, this call will be queued and executed when the player's runloop is ready. The list of supported URIs includes:
        • Single track
        • Playlists
        • Albums
        • Artists
        • Playlist folder
        • Radio
        • Toplist
        Specified by:
        playUri in interface Player
        Parameters:
        callback - operation result callback
        uri - URI to play
        index - A zero-based index from which to play.
        positionInMs - A position to start playback from at the given index.

      • queue

        public void queue(Player.OperationCallback callback,
                  String uri)
        Add a URI to be played next in the queue. Note that not all types of Spotify URIs are supported, see the documentation for playUri(com.spotify.sdk.android.player.Player.OperationCallback,String,int,int) for a list of supported URIs.
        Specified by:
        queue in interface Player
        Parameters:
        callback - operation result callback
        uri - URI to play

      • skipToPrevious

        public void skipToPrevious(Player.OperationCallback callback)

        Specified by:

      • setPlaybackBitrate

        public void setPlaybackBitrate(Player.OperationCallback callback,
                               PlaybackBitrate playbackBitrate)
        Set the bitrate of the player to specified value. This will take effect for the next chunk of audio data that is streamed from the backend. The format or sample rate of the audio data does not change.
        Specified by:
        setPlaybackBitrate in interface Player
        Parameters:
        callback - operation result callback
        playbackBitrate - The bitrate to set playback to. By default is is set to PlaybackBitrate.BITRATE_NORMAL
        See Also:
        for details

      • setConnectivityStatus

        public void setConnectivityStatus(Player.OperationCallback callback,
                                  Connectivity status)
        The native SDK needs to be told what the current connection state is in order to determine ideal connection settings to Spotify's servers. For more information on the usage of this method, see the Connectivity class and the demo app source code which is shipped with the Spotify SDK for Android.
        Specified by:
        setConnectivityStatus in interface Player
        Parameters:
        callback - operation result callback
        status - Connectivity status
        See Also:
        Connectivity.fromNetworkType(int)
